meanings.definition: Small, red berries with a tart taste.
meanings.sent1: I picked some cranberries from the bush.
meanings.sent2: My favorite pie has a layer of cranberries on top.
meanings.sent3: The cranberries rolled off the table and onto the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a bowl of cranberries, bright and refreshing.
meanings.sent5: The cranberries in the salad added a burst of flavor.

meanings.definition: A sauce or relish made from cranberries.
meanings.sent1: I spread cranberries on my toast for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: The cranberries in the sauce gave it a tangy flavor.
meanings.sent3: The cranberries danced in the pot as they cooked.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like cranberries, sweet and sharp at the same time.
meanings.sent5: The cranberries in the relish were a perfect balance of sweet and sour.

meanings.definition: A plant of the heath family, with small, evergreen leaves and pink flowers.
meanings.sent1: The cranberries in the garden added a pop of color.
meanings.sent2: I spotted a bee buzzing around the cranberries in the yard.
meanings.sent3: The cranberries whispered secrets to the other plants.
meanings.sent4: The cranberries stood tall among the other flowers, like a queen in a garden.
meanings.sent5: The scent of the cranberries filled the air with a fresh fragrance.
